net.hudup.em

Class AbstractEM

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.alg.AbstractAlg
      • net.hudup.em.AbstractEM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.hudup.core.alg.Alg, net.hudup.core.alg.TestingAlg, EM
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExponentialEM, GEM

    public abstract class AbstractEM
extends net.hudup.core.alg.AbstractAlg
implements EM
    AbstractEM is the most abstract class for expectation maximization (EM) algorithm. It implements partially the interface EM. For convenience, implementation of an EM algorithm should extend this class.
    Version:
    1.0*
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setup

        public void setup(net.hudup.core.data.Dataset dataset,
                  java.lang.Object... info)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EM
        Setting up this EM based on specified dataset. In this current version, this method initialize the data sample for learning parameter.
        Specified by:
        setup in interface EM
        Parameters:
        dataset - specified dataset.
        info - additional parameters to set up this EM. This parameter is really an array of sub-parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any error raises.

      • unsetup

        public void unsetup()
        Description copied from interface: EM
        Unset this EM. After this method is called, this EM cannot be used unless the method EM.setup(Dataset, Object...) is called again.
        Specified by:
        unsetup in interface EM
